paper_abstract: A set QaS dagger V is a hub set of a graph G=(V,E) if, for every pair of vertices u,vaVa-Q, there exists a path from u to v such that all intermediate vertices are in Q. The hub number of G is the minimum size of a hub set in G. This paper derives the hub numbers of SierpiA"ski-like graphs including: SierpiA"ski graphs, extended SierpiA"ski graphs, and SierpiA"ski gasket graphs. Meanwhile, the corresponding minimum hub sets are also obtained.
paper_title: The Hub Number of Sierpinski-Like Graphs
